text: This is a list of female Muslim heads of State and Government head of Government and State. Some countries do not have a Muslim majority. The list is chronological. ==List== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! colspan="2" |Head of Government or State !Country !Status !In office (first time) |- |100px |Benazir Bhutto | |Prime Minister of Pakistan | 2 December 1988 – 6 August 1990 |- |100px |Khaleda Zia | |Prime Minister of Bangladesh |20 March 1991 – 30 March 1996 |- |100px |Tansu Çiller | |Prime Minister of Turkey | 25 June 1993 – 6 March 1996 |- |100px |Sheikh Hasina | |Prime Minister of Bangladesh | 23 June 1996 – 15 July 2001 |- | |Mame Madior Boye | |Prime Minister of Senegal | 3 March 2001 – 4 November 2002 |- |100px |Megawati Sukarnoputri | |President of Indonesia | 23 July 2001 – 20 October 2004 |- |100px |Roza Otunbayeva | |President of Kyrgyzstan | 7 April 2010 – 1 December 2011 |- |100px |Atifete Jahjaga | |President of Kosovo |7 April 2011 – 7 April 2016 |- | |Cissé Mariam Kaïdama Sidibé | |Prime Minister of Mali | 3 April 2011 – 22 March 2012 |- |100px |Sibel Siber | |Prime Minister of Northern Cyprus | 13 June 2013 – 2 September 2013 |- |100px |Aminata Touré | |Prime Minister of Senegal | 3 September 2013 – 8 July 2014 |-style="background-color: #9BDDFF" |100px |Sheikh Hasina | |Prime Minister of Bangladesh | 6 January 2009 – incumbent |- |100px |Ameenah Gurib | |President of Mauritius | 5 June 2015 – 23 March 2018 |- style="background-color: #9BDDFF" |125x125px |Halimah Yacob | |President of Singapore |14 September 2017 – Incumbent |} ==See also== * * *Muslim-majority *Muslim-majority First female heads of governments, Muslim-majority First female government heads First female government heads Female government heads First female heads of government, Muslim-majority First female heads of government, Muslim-majority Category:Lists of women
title: List of female Muslim heads of Government and State
